refnamediv.refpurpose: instantiate store derivations from Nix expressions

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The command nix-instantiate generates store derivations from (high-level) Nix expressions. It loads and evaluates the Nix expressions in each of files. Each top-level expression should evaluate to a derivation, a list of derivations, or a set of derivations. The paths of the resulting store derivations are printed on standard output.
If files is the character -, then a Nix expression will be read from standard input.

Most users and developers donâ€™t need to use this command (nix-env and nix-build perform store derivation instantiation from Nix expressions automatically). It is most commonly used for implementing new deployment policies.
See also for a list of common options.

listitem.para: See the corresponding options in nix-store.
Just parse the input files, and print their abstract syntax trees on standard output in ATerm format.
Just parse and evaluate the input files, and print the resulting values on standard output. No instantiation of store derivations takes place.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.screen:
$ nix-instantiate test.nix (instantiate) /nix/store/cigxbmvy6dzix98dxxh9b6shg7ar5bvs-perl-BerkeleyDB-0.26.drv
$ nix-store -r $(nix-instantiate test.nix) (build) ... /nix/store/qhqk4n8ci095g3sdp93x7rgwyh9rdvgk-perl-BerkeleyDB-0.26 (output path)
$ ls -l /nix/store/qhqk4n8ci095g3sdp93x7rgwyh9rdvgk-perl-BerkeleyDB-0.26 dr-xr-xr-x 2 eelco users 4096 1970-01-01 01:00 lib ...
